data.title: Great Evironment and simple great food
data.text: This is one of my favorite place to eat. The ambiance is refreshing; the people working there are extremely friendly and the music is so soothing. The food is awesome, the meat is always flavorful.

data.title: Great food
data.text: As far as barbecue, it does not get any better. It's a must stop when passing through or regular visit for those in the area. My one and only suggestion would be do not sit in the booths running along the wall from the door. When the line for ordering backs up along the booths, people are hip to your table while you are eating.

data.title: Family dinner and lunch
data.text: Great family place and excellent barbecue- for the guys they wished they could have had a beer with that delicious meat!

data.title: The Best in Phoenix
data.text: The best BBQ in Phoenix in the quaint downtown Gilbert.   My favorite is the sliced beef brisket. I like it best since there is just a little bit of BBQ sauce but of course you can add more.  It gives you more options.  Whereas the regular maximum BBQ has the sauce already added.   Has great sides too.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
Love the food and quick service. The walk-up take out window is a welcome option for those who call ahead so they don't have to wait in line to pick up their order inside. 
The line does move extremely fast so don't get discouraged from trying this place if you see it wrapping around the building.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text: Food was good. Don't try the "I dare you" hot sauce unless you really, really like it HOT. Staff was friendly. Would go back

data.title: Love this home town restaurant.
data.text: This is our go to restaurant for birthday celebrations for all of our family members!  Love the value, quality of food and outdoor seating, picnic style under festive lights.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: Hubby and I ate there for lunch.  He had pulled pork sandwich and I had a pulled pork/ chicken meal.  We tried the homemade root beer.  Everything was excellent, waiters were helpful, tables were cleaned off right away, place seemed clean.  Would definitely go back and would recommend this place.

data.title: Fantastic BBQ
data.text:
Be prepare to wait in line but it is worth the wait.  The food is great lots of choices 
especially choose of sides my husband favor place to go eat beside the the BBQ meat
they have this Huge potatoes that you can fill with whatever you want.
Also if it happen to be your birthday on the day you go they will take $10.00 off your bill.

data.title: Decent, but below average
data.text: The brisket is average at best...The shreaded pork was was good...in my opinion the pork was extremely dry...The brisket wa moist but barkless. Atmosphere was clean and nice. Their homemade was thighlight of our trip there.

data.title: Mr tw
data.text: I'm from Texas and this is awful darn close to the real thing! No surprises just great food you put all the fixings on everything just come with the great appetite

data.title: Richard's Birthday Dinner!
data.text:
This place is the REAL DEAL! 

A little unconventional, but awesome just the same. You park in the back and walk in to a very large indoor seating area. There's also tons of picnic tables outside in case you are a really messy eater! The inside is decorated with a full size tractor and some other cool farm stuff. 
The way this place works is you get in a line to order. Along the way you pick up your own tray, cutlery, drinks, and flatware. You eventually (doesn't take too long, even on a Friday night!) get to the cafeteria-type counter where you slide your tray along the counter in front of the restaurant staff who dish up your meals. If you are ordering more than one dinner you should think about keeping your family in line with you to help carry the trays, they can be heavy!
There are paper menus available and the whole menu is also on the wall or somewhere we easily saw it. At the end of the counter you pay the lady, and then go to your table. Trust me, even on a super busy Friday night we were easily able to seat all 12 of our party. 
They also have friendly staff circulating in the dining room to see if you need anything or to take away empty trays or plates. They also assist you in the beginning if you can't figure out the line or the way to order properly. Very helpful, very friendly, and make you feel like family. This makes sense because it is a family run business, and it shows.

Now the food: nothing was less than EXCELLENT. The brisket was extra special and so was the pulled pork. You cannot go wrong with anything here. They have a big smoker out back and put it to good use. We have some pretty solid BBQ joints in Southern California but I'd put this one up against any of them and I'm pretty sure Joe's would win!

Bottom line: GO. Check it out. Be ready to take a lot home due to portion size. Save room for dessert....okay, that will never happen. But you could take some dessert home anyway. OR eat it first??? 

ProTip: Outside on their lawn is a great place for the kids to run around after dinner while the adults are sitting around nearby fighting off their food coma's. :D  Enjoy!

data.title: It's ok
data.text: I used to love this place but now think it's just average. I do like the ambiance. Very relaxed. The pulled pork, beans and mac n cheese are all delicious!

data.title: Very good quality meats, very expensive.
data.text: I thought they served very high quality meats,  but thought that $20 for lunch was very expensive.  It was crowded so many people were enjoying their meal.

data.title: Still good after all these years
data.text: We have been coming to Joe's since it opened in 1998. It is still good BBQ. We love to bring out of town guests here.

data.title: Gilbert, Az
data.text: Fantastic! We didn't eat inside but picked up our order at the back window. Fair prices and super fast service. My BBQ sandwich was delicious and the pit beans are amazing.

data.title: Real Indeed
data.text: It's not fancy and it's not table service.  It's just real good food.  I had a 1/4 lb. brisket sandwich with Cole slaw and beans.  My wife had pulled pork.  The slaw included caraway seed, which gave it an unexpected (but good) flavor.  Kansas City is known for BBQ, but Joe's is right up there.

data.title: Birthday Goodies
data.text: We took my mom here for a birthday lunch.. they give you ten dollars towards a meal which is simply UNHEARD of these days. Good meats and lots of it, just not the best BBQ I've had. The pulled pork sandwich was good and you get sides with it, too.

data.title: First time and not the last time!
data.text:
Fabulous, simple BBQ and other fixins! Although cafeteria style line it moves very quickly and its great to see the food up close. Several sandwich options- helpful to visit website first. Salads are huge; come with an appetite! Has gluten free options; desserts look heavenly. Homemade root beer on site. Simple dining room great for all ages- very clean establishment and friendly staff. 15 years of BBQ excellence right here! Take out available via a walk up window-
You wont be disappointed! Great food - great service- thanks Joe's REAL BBQ!

data.title: Charming and great BBQ
data.text: I have lived in Gilbert for more than 19 years and Joe's BBQ is an original in the Old Town Gilbert establishment.  Long before the current, new hip places popped up across from Joe's, this place has been serving locals a wonderful selection of BBQ meats and sides for many years.  I personally love the huge russet potatoes, salads and the old fashioned root beer.  The place has a charming western, farm decor with indoor and outdoor seating.  Great food and ambience!
